property.name: Max Data to Post per Second
Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)
SQL select query
property.value: SELECT OOBF_SHIP_DTL.SERIAL_NO as ID, OOBF_SHIP_HDR.SHIP_DATE as DT, 'SHIP' as TAG, OOBF_SHIP_DTL.ASSEMBLY_NO, OOBF_SHIP_HDR.CUSTOMER, OOBF_SHIP_HDR.CUSTOMER_NAME, OOBF_SHIP_HDR.I_D_SHIPMENT as INT_DOM FROM QMS.OOBF_SHIP_DTL LEFT JOIN QMS.OOBF_SHIP_HDR ON OOBF_SHIP_DTL.RESPONSE_NO=OOBF_SHIP_HDR.RESPONSE_NO where ASSEMBLY_NO like '15%' and length(ASSEMBLY_NO)=12 and length(SERIAL_NO)>6 and SERIAL_NO='${http.query.string}'

property.name: Log level when file not found
SQL select query
property.value: SELECT H_TRAVELER_HDR.SERIAL_NO as ID,H_TRAVELER_HDR.DATE_RECD as DT, 'RECD' as TAG, H_TRAVELER_HDR.ASSEMBLY_NO, H_TRAVELER_HDR.CONTACT, H_TRAVELER_HDR.ANALYSIS_CLOSURE_CODE, H_TRAVELER_HDR.DATE_MALFUNCT, H_TRAVELER_HDR.CUSTOMER, H_TRAVELER_HDR.CUSTOMER_ID, H_TRAVELER_HDR.INT_DOM, H_TRAVELER_HDR.RETURN_CODE, H_TRAVELER_HDR.COMPLAINT, H_TRAVELER_HDR.REMARKS, H_TRAVELER_HDR.COMPLAINT_TYPE_CODE, QMS_FTR_T.MALFUNCT, QMS_FTR_B.CKT_LOC, QMS_FTR_B.ASSEMBLY_NO as BOARD, QMS_FTR_B.DEFECT, QMS_FTR_B.REPAIR, QMS_FTR_B.DEBUG_DATE AS DT1, QMS_FTR_B.FIX, QMS_FTR_B.REPAIR_COMPLETE_FLAG, QMS_FTR_B.DEFECT_CODE, H_TRAVELER_HDR.STATUS, PART_MASTER_LU.DESCRIPTION, H_TRAVELER_HDR.HNS_RMA_NO, H_TRAVELER_HDR.TRAV_NO, QMS_FTR_T.CYCLE_NO, QMS_FTR_T.FTR_NO as ID1,case when CUSTOMER_ID='RMA' and COMPLAINT_TYPE_CODE in ('P0','N0') or RETURN_CODE='RC' or RETURN_CODE='RL' then 'CHURN' else 'FAIL' end as RETURN_REASON,case when ANALYSIS_CLOSURE_CODE in ('03','05') then 1 else 0 end as VERDICT from H_TRAVELER_HDR left join QMS_FTR_T on H_TRAVELER_HDR.TRAV_NO = QMS_FTR_T.CYCLE_NO left join QMS_FTR_B on QMS_FTR_B.FTR_NO = QMS_FTR_T.FTR_NO left join PART_MASTER_LU on QMS_FTR_B.ASSEMBLY_NO = PART_MASTER_LU.ASSEMBLY_NO where H_TRAVELER_HDR.ASSEMBLY_NO like '${http.query.string}%' and length(H_TRAVELER_HDR.SERIAL_NO)>6

property.name: SQL select query
property.value: select AccountNumber as ID, cast(AccountCreationDate as Date) as DT, 'ACT_mssql' as TAG, AdapterModel,BeamId,RiskScore,ValueScore,SalesChannel,BillToZipCode from Dimension.DimAccount where AccountNumber='${http.query.string}'

template.description: An Ad Hoc web service that "enriches" a request to port 8011 with a NiFi greeting utilizing HandleHttpRequest, HandleHttpResponse and the StandardHttpContextMap controller service
template.name: Hello NiFi Web Service

processGroups.comments: An Ad Hoc web service that "enriches" a request to port 8011 with a NiFi greeting utilizing HandleHttpRequest, HandleHttpResponse and the StandardHttpContextMap controller service

labels.label: This processor could be replaced with an entire flow of logic.

processors.name: Update Request Body with a greeting!

processGroups.name: Hello NiFi Web Service

template.description:
This example flow takes advantage of NiFi's ability to stream its own provenance data through the flow which it can then read, write, route, and transform for some interesting cases. The provenance data it generates then becomes its own stream to experiment with.
To do this we take advantage of the site to site reporting task for provenance, the new QueryRecord processor powered by Apache Calcite, various record readers and writers including a custom one built on the fly using Groovy all to read in the provenance stream while simultaneously writing it out in JSON, Avro, CSV, and XML. All this really helps highlight the power this makes available as we get to reuse the same components but plugin in separate concerns such as formats and schemas which we can reuse at various points in the flow. Another great benefit here is we don't have to split data into individual records before the processors can operate on them. Through the record abstraction it understands how to parse, demarcate, and reproduce the transformed output without this having to be a concern of the user or the processors themselves. This creates tremendous reuse, flexibility, and massive performance benefits all while still maintaining full fidelity of the provenance trail!
template.name: Provenance Stream Record ReadWrite

config.comments: The CSV Data coming from randomuser.me contains a header line but does not have a # on the beginning. This Processor adds the # to the beginning of the first line.
